items.title: 'A stellar legacy on and off the field' - Hugh Morris obituary
items.summary: Hugh Morris, who has died at the of 62, enjoyed a distinguished career in which he led from the front both on and off the cricket field.

items.title: Ex-England batter and ECB boss Morris dies
items.summary: Hugh Morris, the former England and Glamorgan batter and England and Wales Cricket Board chief executive, has died at the age of 62.

items.title: Ex-England and Glamorgan batter and ECB boss Morris dies

items.title: Chelsea investigate after bottle thrown at Villa bench

items.title: This Realme smartphone with a 10,001 mAh battery is launching soon
items.summary: Realme showed off a prototype smartphone with a 10,000 mAh battery in May and said it would launch a 7,500 mAh battery phone this year, while also revealing that a 10,000 mAh model was coming soon. Well, so far, we've only got 7,000 mAh battery smartphones from Realme, which include the flagship GTâ€¦

That I'm in a very privileged position is not lost on me either, so first and foremost, thank all of you for reading and watching us all yâ€¦

items.summary: Tecno unveiled the Pova Curve in May, and we expected its successor to arrive during the same period next year. But it appears the Tecno Pova Curve 2 may launch early, as its render and specs have surfaced online. The source claims that the Tecno Pova Curve 2 will be powered by the yet-to-be-announâ€¦

items.title: How releasing Reijnders gave Man City win at Forest

items.summary: Raul Jimenez scores in the 85th minute as Fulham extend West Ham United's winless run to seven games.

items.summary: Kevin Schade scores a hat-trick as Brentford beat Bournemouth 4-1.

items.summary: Liverpool score twice within a minute as Florian Wirtz scores his first goal for his side to beat Wolverhampton Wanderers 2-1.

items.summary: Rayan Cherki assists in the first half and scores late in the second for Manchester City to beat Nottingham Forest 2-1 and get their sixth Premier League win in a row.

items.title: Arsenal return to top of table with win over Brighton
items.summary: Arsenal return to the top of the table with Martin Odegaard scoring his first Premier League goal of the season to beat Brighton 2-1.

items.title: Watkins double fires Aston Villa to stunning win at Chelsea
